feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [magento/project-community-edition] Magento Open Source allows Information Exposure
entry.content:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.6 (and earlier), 2.4.5-p2 (and earlier) and 2.4.4-p3 (and earlier) are affected by an Information Exposure vulnerability that could lead to a security feature bypass. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to leak minor user data. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction..

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-29287
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb23-35.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-85m4-g9vq-xpxj

entry.title: [magento/project-community-edition] Magento Open Source allows Incorrect Authorization
entry.content:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.6 (and earlier), 2.4.5-p2 (and earlier) and 2.4.4-p3 (and earlier) are affected by an Incorrect Authorization vulnerability that could result in a security feature bypass. A privileged attacker could leverage this vulnerability to modify a minor functionality of another user's data. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-29288
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb23-35.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f989-3fp9-q3r2

entry.title: [magento/project-community-edition] Magento Open Source allows Improper Access Control
entry.content:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.3-p3 (and earlier), 2.4.4-p1 (and earlier) and 2.4.5 (and earlier) are affected by an Improper Access Control vulnerability that could result in a Security feature bypass. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to impact the availability of a user's minor feature. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-35689
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb22-48.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5fxx-jwjm-x9hj

entry.title: [magento/project-community-edition] Magento Open Source allows XML Injection
entry.content:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.4-p2 (and earlier) and 2.4.5-p1 (and earlier) are affected by an XML Injection vulnerability that could lead to arbitrary file system read. An unauthenticated attacker can force the application to make arbitrary requests via injection of arbitrary URLs. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22247
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb23-17.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2444-8gj8-6fmx

entry.content:

An unauthenticated attacker can force the application to make arbitrary requests via injection of arbitrary URLs. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22247
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb23-17.html
